page.title: 01BISHOPS HALL
page.content: The area surveyed is a mixed residential and agricultural area to the north of the dormitory town of Brentwood which provides all main services apart from small shopping parades, primary schools and the mobile library. Much of the through traffic has disappeared following the opening of the M25 in 1983. The outlying villages are largely populated by middle class people working in London or locally and most of the older houses have been modern_ ised. A few farms have been bought by businessmen ofen uninterested in cultivating land but hoping to sell some for development. The farms still working produce arable crops. The area is generally affluent with high car ownership and poor public transport. Most residents find it a quiet pleasant area to live in.
